Description: Palette of mudstone of rhombic or diamond shape with thick body and rounded edges, oval in cross-section. The contours are irregular. Broken at one end.
Curator's comments: Similar to Petrie’s type 90H, see Corpus of Prehistoric pottery and palettes, 1920, pl. lviii. The projection of the points on the long sides are typical of the earliest palettes in this shape. Found in incomplete state in an intact grave of a woman, placed before her face: see E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, 'Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna' (London, 1911), p. 13; pl. iii.12.
